page.title: 16CHURCH
page.content: The church has always been important to village life. The three parishes of Belchamp St.Paul, Ovington and Tilbury Juxta-Clare are combined with one Vicar who lives in the new Vicarage in Belchamp St.Paul. The builings are historical monuments and are lovingly maintained. Â£36,000 was recently raised to repair St.Andrew's B.St.Paul A Church of England family communion service is held on Sundays at 10.00 am and there are extra services at Easter Harvest and Christmas. Christenings, weddings and funerals also take place as necessary. Many people visit the churches at Harvest Festival time when they are beautifully decorated. It costs over Â£2000 to run a church so money is raised by collections, a grant from the Parish Council and functions such as a Fete in the summer and a Social Afternoon at Christmas.
